snippet: Mr. Sendak, known in particular for “Where the Wild Things Are,” was widely considered the most important children’s book artist of the 20th century.
abstract: Maurice Sendak, widely considered the most important children's book artist of the 20th century, dies at age 83; Sendak wrenched the picture book out of the safe, sanitized world of the nursery and plunged it into the dark, terrifying and hauntingly beautiful recesses of the human psyche, most famously with his classic Where the Wild Things Are.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Sendak, known in particular for “Where the Wild Things Are,” was widely considered the most important children’s book artist of the 20th century.

headline.seo: Maurice Sendak, Children’s Author, Dies at 83
headline.main: Maurice Sendak, Author of Splendid Nightmares, Dies at 83
headline.print_headline: Maurice Sendak, 1928-2012: A Conjurer of Luminous Worlds, Both Beautiful and Terrifying
